definition: to view as/to see as/to consider to be/to deem
to look at/to regard/to inspect
old variant of 視|视[shi4]
variant of 視|视[shi4]/variant of 示[shi4]
variant of 為|为[wei4], because of/for/to
because of/for/to
variant of 為|为[wei2]/as (i.e. in the capacity of)/to take sth as/to act as/to serve as/to behave as/to become/to be/to do
as (in the capacity of)/to take sth as/to act as/to serve as/to behave as/to become/to be/to do/by (in the passive voice)
to view as dangerous (idiom); afraid to do sth
to consider sb as close friend (idiom); to take into one's confidence

sentences.english: Offenses with this characteristic usually will be encountered as assimilative crimes.
sentences.chinese: 带有此特征的犯罪行为通常将视为同等犯罪。

sentences.english: Chinese culture sees all non-Chinese as sub-human, to be exploited.
sentences.chinese: 中国文化把所有的其他人种视为有待剥削的次等民族。

sentences.english: Have a both husband and wife the old age son, see as the darling a baby.
sentences.chinese: 有一家夫妻俩老年得子，视为心肝宝贝。

sentences.english: Maria Montessori started a school for children that were regarded as unteachable.
sentences.chinese: 玛丽亚蒙台梭利开始为孩子的学校被定为不可教视为。

sentences.english: "What level of risk can be considered tolerable?
sentences.chinese: “什么程度的危险能被视为可以容忍？”

sentences.english: Victorians saw a cleft palate as a defect that built character.
sentences.chinese: 维多利亚时代将腭裂视为塑造特征的缺陷。

sentences.english: Entry form is invalid if not properly completed or with insufficient supporting materials.
sentences.chinese: 报名表填写不清或资料不齐者，一概视为无效。

sentences.english: Cholera was recognized as an indicator of how well the environment is managed.
sentences.chinese: 霍乱被视为可衡量环境治理成果的一项指标。

sentences.english: The DAB shall be deemed to be not acting as arbitrator(s).
sentences.chinese: 争端裁决委员不应被视为作为仲裁人。

sentences.english: Commercial fishing routinely ranks as America’s most lethal job.
sentences.chinese: 商业捕渔一直被视为是美国最危险的工作。

sentences.english: Indicates that an array in a structure or non-local variable should be treated as a fixed-length array.
sentences.chinese: 表示结构或非区域变数的阵列应视为固定长度的阵列。

sentences.english: 'They see them as status symbols, ' Dr. Chen says.
sentences.chinese: 陈焕然称，啤酒肚被视为一种地位的象征。

sentences.english: The researchers also studied the number of people who are said to be underweight in different countries.
sentences.chinese: 研究人员还研究了不同国家被视为体重不足者的人数。

sentences.english: We foresee a soft landing, but this cannot be taken for granted.
sentences.chinese: 我们预期会出现软着陆，但不能将其视为理所当然。

sentences.english: Artificers treat mastery of magic like a technical skill.
sentences.chinese: 机关术士将魔法的掌握视为一种技术性的能力。

sentences.english: The Medication Guide will be considered to be an element of the REMS.
sentences.chinese: 用药指南将被视为一个新的要素。

definition: to regard as/to treat as
to look upon as/to regard as
to treat as/to regard as
to regard as/to look upon as
to regard as
to regard the same as/to regard as being the same as
to be called/to be known as
to be classified as
called/to call sth (by a name)/to name
one's conduct/deed/activity/accomplishment/achievement/to act as/as (in the capacity of)/qua/to view as/to look upon (sth as)/to take sth to be
to believe/to think/to consider/to feel
to include on a list
to look at/to regard/to inspect
old variant of 視|视[shi4]
variant of 視|视[shi4]/variant of 示[shi4]
to act as/used erroneously for 作為|作为
to assign (to a class)/to classify as/to include
thus/consequently/as a result
